newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: NAB says govt mergers stance disappoints.
newsitem.headline: NAB says govt mergers stance disappoints.

text.p: Australia's biggest and most profitable bank, National Australia Bank Ltd, on Wednesday welcomed the recommendations of the Wallis inquiry into the financial system but said the government's response on mergers was disappointing.
"We believe that the Government could have permitted mergers provided they met the necessary competition standards," managing director Don Argus said in a statement.
Shares in NAB, previously seen as a possible bidder for Westpac, rose after the Treasurer's statement.
NAB's Argus said the bank understood the government's concerns about timing and the effect big bank mergers would have on small business lending.
"The onus is one those favouring mergers to address these concerns and we believe that is certainly possible," he said.
Argus said the Wallis report was consistent with NAB's views on competition, industry structure and the payments system.
